instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a PPBUS 8.20-8.40 V
threads.message:
Got this board that fan spins but nothing more.

First ppbus was 8.2 V and i changed SMC from donor board. Now when plug magsafe it has no light. and ppbus is 8.2V if reset SMC i fan spins and ppbus is 8.4V but macbook doesnt boot. 

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> 3V

Any idea? Bad SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a PPBUS 8.20-8.40 V
threads.message:
Could be solder problem on SMC.
Reflow and carefuly tap it until dance a bit.
If still the same, reball it.
Finally changed it, if still same issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a PPBUS 8.20-8.40 V
threads.message: thanks Informaticos. Will do it tomorrow. My gues also was bad solder or bad smc.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a PPBUS 8.20-8.40 V
threads.message: confirmed. bad soldered smc. Reballed it again and now working fine. thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a PPBUS 8.20-8.40 V
threads.message: I have a board like this with a similar defect, it presents <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.4v, <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>--3.4v , would the SMC be the defect? I have already replaced the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and do not contain oxidation or corroded components.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a PPBUS 8.20-8.40 V
threads.message:
Welcome to the forum!

Please do not hijack another thread.
Same symptom can be caused by different issue.
Open new thread, as you will need to post various signals and voltages...
